Description: HP JetDirect printers versions G.08.20 and H.08.20 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a malformed FTP quote command.
Reasoning: Improperly implemented, the vulnerability results from poor handling of an input command that is not properly checked by the printers, so a malicious command can lead to DOS. It directly involves the operation of the FTP protocol and is a result of improper handling of FTP requests.

Description: Microsoft FTP Service 7.0 and 7.5 for Internet Information Services (IIS) processes unspecified commands before TLS is enabled for a session, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading the replies to these commands, aka "FTP Command Injection Vulnerability."
Reasoning: Logic flaw, This vulnerability in Microsoft's FTP Service allows sensitive information disclosure by processing commands before TLS is enabled, leveraging a conceptual weakness in the FTP protocol. (Can lead to Session Hijacking, Command Injection Pre-TLS, Information Disclosure).

Description: Buffer overflows in Squid before 2.4.STABLE6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code (1) via the MSNT auth helper (msnt_auth) when using denyusers or allowusers files, (2) via the gopher client, or (3) via the FTP server directory listing parser when HTML output is generated.
Reasoning: incorrect implementation, incorrect handling of FTP data, leading to buffer overflow vulnerabilities (allowing DOS or arbitrary code execution). It directly related to FTP protocol.

Description: The IOS FTP Server in Cisco IOS 11.3 through 12.4 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (IOS reload) via unspecified vectors involving transferring files (aka bug ID CSCse29244).
Reasoning: Denial of service vulnerability in Cisco IOS FTP server due to unspecified vectors involving file transfers. This flaw directly involves the operation of the FTP protocol Therefor It's related this protocol.

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in ElectraSoft 32bit FTP 09.04.24 allows remote FTP servers to execute arbitrary code via a long banner.  NOTE: this might overlap CVE-2003-1368.
Reasoning: Incorrect implementation, stack-based buffer overflow in ElectraSoft's FTP client due to a long banner from remote FTP servers (allowing arbitrary code execution). This flaw directly involves the operation of the FTP protocol therefor It's related to this protocol.

Description: Vesta Control Panel (VestaCP) through 0.9.8-26 allows Command Injection via the schedule/backup Backup Listing Endpoint. The attacker must be able to create a crafted filename on the server, as demonstrated by an FTP session that renames .bash_logout to a .bash_logout' substring followed by shell metacharacters.
Reasoning: allows Command injection, exploits the vulnerability by using an FTP session to rename a file

Description: Format string vulnerability in Pablo FTP Server 1.5, 1.3, and possibly other versions, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via format strings in the USER command.
Reasoning: the Format String Vulnerability affects the Pablo FTP Server, which is an FTP (File Transfer Protocol) server software.

Description: The IOS FTP Server in Cisco IOS 11.3 through 12.4 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (IOS reload) via unspecified vectors involving transferring files (aka bug ID CSCse29244).
Reasoning: The FTP server allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors involving transferring files

Description: HP JetDirect printers versions G.08.20 and H.08.20 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a malformed FTP quote command.
Reasoning: using FTP quote command to create dos attack
